quote.msg:
1）想間屋做到呢類效果要預幾多錢？
2）呢類風格既裝修係咪叫輕奢風？點形容俾設計師或者裝修師傅聽？
3）可唔可以係主力牆開個門口位？

1。睇你單位幾大，同埋係咪全翻新做哂廚房廁所先答到你
2。講真無一個特別既名你可以直接俾圖個設計師睇話大概要呢類型
3。正常唔可以

謝謝
1）大約600尺全爆，做到咁既裝修要幾錢？
3）如果做左，係咪幢樓好有危機（睇樓時見到有人主力牆開左個門口位，又有人直情拆左幅主力牆變做用櫃間牆）

replies.msg:
1。做到呢個風格嘅話大概都要60萬，未計材料，例如雲石地板磚，你用唔同嘅雲石同磚個價錢可以相差好遠所以其實好多公司都唔會包材料，另外淨係改間隔同埋泥水其實已經好重成本
3。正常情況下係要入則，要搵建築師嚟望過可唔可以做呢一個動作，另外建築師亦都要簽名作實佢判斷過呢件事可行，不過我係你就唔會亂郁主力牆因為始終風險好大

replies.msg:
岩岩記得答埋你LED燈
你唔係不停咁玩D燈其實正正常都好耐用
安裝都唔難，但要留意返你個隻LED燈係行4條線定2條線，呢個會影響D電線點行，呢方面要電燈師父同燈舖D人先答到你
但我D客裝完個個都話頭個幾個月有玩過下之後好少用到

樓主有冇作品分享下
想搵啲簡約裝修
MUJI風果種
唔想自爆
但係如果你想係muji風格既話，唔會建議你大裝修
因為嗰種風格其實大致上都係白色長木色地板做少少燈槽
最主要係傢俬上嘅配搭
如果你大裝修要做嘅話，可以搵裝修師傅就OK唔好曬太多錢去搵設計公司，因為真係唔值得
唔會大裝修呀
但唔知邊到買/整傢私好
淨係想買張床同幾個櫃同sofa
同埋唔知啲傢私點擺好
去一轉海怡廣場大把你睇，我好多時都會陪客去揀傢俬
傢俬顏色方面我會建議你用oak wood，比較暖既感覺
傢俬擺位要睇你floor plan先幫到你喇

我打錯字好多人問我去邊睇

首先你呎2張係3D效果圖黎
另外就係呢類型既牆身我哋行內叫特色牆/圍身
圍身嘅面料多數都係用木皮貼落夾板上面再安裝係牆身
第一張圖望落就似會係用牆紙貼落牆身或底板既效果
牆身就係油漆師傅做既
第二張圖就係我所講既木皮圍身
木皮圍身就要木工師父做
如果你搵師父或設計公司，你可以同佢哋講你想做圍身
大多數行家師父都會明白點做

SPC contains polyvinyl chloride which can be very dangerous to humans.

Recommendations for consumers:
Here are some tips consumers can follow to reduce their exposure to toxic phthalates in flooring.

Avoid vinyl flooring containing phthalates. Use the ratings on www.HealthyStuff.org to identify flooring that do and don’t contain phthalates.
Only purchase flooring that the manufacturer or retailer has indicated is “phthalate-free.” Double-check with the company that it does not contain recycled vinyl, which is often contaminated with phthalates.
Avoid vinyl flooring that contains recycled vinyl content. Recycled vinyl is often contaminated with toxic contaminants such as phthalates and heavy metals (e.g. lead and cadmium). See the new report from Healthy Building Network that examines this.


The best option is to purchase PVC-free flooring whenever possible, as from production to disposal PVC uses and releases other hazardous chemicals.

As far as I read, SPC is NOT as natural and health-friendly as most salesmen described. It requires no glue but it is still a version of vinyl afterall.

https://www.asiaone.com/lifestyle/how-choose-your-material-spc-flooring
Rising in popularity in recent years, SPC flooring is sometimes seen as the V2.0 of vinyl flooring.
SPC stands for Stone Plastic (or Polymer) Composite, features a core that is typically comprised of around 60% calcium carbonate (limestone), polyvinyl chloride and plasticizers.
The core material of SPC flooring is composed of mixed limestone and PVC-based resin.

PVC + Stabilizer = same as vinyl = evil to health
又學到野

https://saferchemicals.org/get-the-facts/toxic-chemicals/vinyl-chloride/

SPC contains polyvinyl chloride which can be very dangerous to humans.

Recommendations for consumers:
Here are some tips consumers can follow to reduce their exposure to toxic phthalates in flooring.

Avoid vinyl flooring containing phthalates. Use the ratings on www.HealthyStuff.org to identify flooring that do and don’t contain phthalates.
Only purchase flooring that the manufacturer or retailer has indicated is “phthalate-free.” Double-check with the company that it does not contain recycled vinyl, which is often contaminated with phthalates.
Avoid vinyl flooring that contains recycled vinyl content. Recycled vinyl is often contaminated with toxic contaminants such as phthalates and heavy metals (e.g. lead and cadmium). See the new report from Healthy Building Network that examines this.


The best option is to purchase PVC-free flooring whenever possible, as from production to disposal PVC uses and releases other hazardous chemicals.
